# managedObjectClassName

**Instance Property**

The name of the class that represents the receiver’s entity.

## Declaration

```swift
var managedObjectClassName: String! { get set }
```

## Discussion

The class specified by `name` must [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObject] or a subclass of [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSManagedObject].

### Special Considerations

Setting the class name raises an exception if the receiver’s model has been used by an object graph manager.

## Getting descriptive information

- **name**: The entity name of the receiver.
- **managedObjectModel**: The managed object model with which the receiver is associated.
- **renamingIdentifier**: The renaming identifier for the receiver.
- **isAbstract**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver represents an abstract entity.
- **userInfo**: The user info dictionary of the receiver.
- **coreSpotlightDisplayNameExpression**: The expression that computes the CoreSpotlight display name for instances of the entity.
